dt: {bc}difficult or impossible for one of ordinary understanding or knowledge to comprehend {bc}{sx|deep||}
{bc}of, relating to, or dealing with something little known or obscure

dt.t: {wi}recondite{/wi} fact about the origin of the holiday

et: Latin {it}reconditus{/it}, past participle of {it}recondere{/it} to conceal, from {it}re-{/it} + {it}condere{/it} to store up, from {it}com-{/it} + {it}-dere{/it} to put {ma}{mat|com-|}, {mat|do|}{/ma}
shortdef: difficult or impossible for one of ordinary understanding or knowledge to comprehend : deep
of, relating to, or dealing with something little known or obscure
